snippet.title: Queensland has hottest July on record
snippet.content: Queensland has recorded its hottest July on record and above-average temperatures are set to continue for the rest of winter. The mean temperature across the state was 2.65C above the long-term average of 15.94 per cent, with Mackay and St George measuring their highest maximum July temperatures on record. The weather bureau's David Crock says the three-month outlook predicts continued high temperatures for the Sunshine State but it's too early to tell if Queensland is in for a scorching summer. (C) AAP 2017
